fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Create a user with username "administrator"
# Login with username "administrator" and create a page A with title 'test1'
# Configure a LDAP connector
# Inside the LDAP directory, create a username "Administrator"
# Make the LDAP directory at the top of the User Directories
# Create another page B with title 'test2'
# [Confluence Search|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Searching+Confluence#SearchingConfluence-PerformingaFullSearch] can only find page B with title 'test2' but cannot find the page A with title 'test1'

There may be other error also.

This error happens because Confluence is using the column *user_name* in the table *cwd_user*. Confluence should have used the column *lower_user_name*. For example, the table *content* is showing "Administrator" in the column *creator* for page B.
fields.summary: External users with different case username from internal user breaks search for previously-created content

fields.description:
When renaming a page all the links that are pointing to that page by having another title shown get broken. 

Example:

Page: Project Plan 

Link on another page to project plan: [This is another name for project plan|Project Plan]

If I rename "Project Plan" to "Project Plan Details" the link gets broken or more specific, it simply not update itself with the new name!

This stands totally in contrast to everything that a knowledge management platform wants to achieve. Can you have a look at that?
fields.summary: Renaming page breaks links with other title shown

fields.description:
h3. Summary of The Bug
ORACLE database users (10/11) could not modify their user directories, due to {{UNIQUE CONSTRAINT}} ERROR thrown by Confluence:
{noformat}
2011-05-07 00:39:13,768 ERROR [http-8353-1] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated

 -- referer: http://localhost:8353/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | userName: admin
2011-05-07 00:39:13,770 ERROR [http-8353-1] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
 -- referer: http://localhost:8353/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | userName: admin
2011-05-07 00:39:13,841 ERROR [http-8353-1] [atlassian.plugin.servlet.ServletModuleContainerServlet] service Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert collection rows: [com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.DirectoryImpl.attributes#327682]; SQL []; ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated

 -- referer: http://localhost:8353/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | userName: admin
org.springframework.web.util.NestedServletException: Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert collection rows: [com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.DirectoryImpl.attributes#327682]; SQL []; ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence 3.5.x instance with ORACLE (10/11) database
# Create a new LDAP Directory, test and save it.
# Edit the directory (modify some of the LDAP attributes, eg. {{User Schema Settings > User Object Filter}}). Test and save. A System Error will be thrown.

h3. Fix
Use the attached patch to resolve the issue. To install the patch, extract it to your <confluence-install-dir>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory. Ensure that the following files are created:
# com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2/HibernateDirectoryDao$1.class
# com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2/HibernateDirectoryDao$2.class
# com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2/HibernateDirectoryDao.class
Then, restart Confluence.

h3. Cause
This occurs due to Oracle treating blank strings and null values as equal, and Hibernate 2 not being smart enough to realise that the same entry already exists, because in Java, a blank string is not equal to a null. This causes Hibernate to try to insert a row that already exists.

h5. MySQL DEBUG log
{noformat}
2011-05-04 18:46:16,007 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log select attributes0_.directory_id as director1___, attributes0_.attribute_value as attribut2___, attributes0_.attribute_name as attribut3___ from cwd_directory_attribute attributes0_ where attributes0_.directory_id=?
2011-05-04 18:46:16,017 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory set directory_name=?, lower_directory_name=?, created_date=?, updated_date=?, active=?, description=?, impl_class=?, lower_impl_class=?, directory_type=? where id=?
2011-05-04 18:46:16,018 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log delete from cwd_directory_attribute where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
2011-05-04 18:46:16,018 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory_attribute set attribute_value=? where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
{noformat}

h5. ORACLE DEBUG log
{noformat}
2011-05-06 23:58:51,560 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory set directory_name=?, lower_directory_name=?, created_date=?, updated_date=?, active=?, description=?, impl_class=?, lower_impl_class=?, directory_type=? where id=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,563 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log delete from cwd_directory_operation where directory_id=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,576 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log delete from cwd_directory_attribute where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,579 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory_attribute set attribute_value=? where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,581 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log insert into cwd_directory_attribute (directory_id, attribute_name, attribute_value) values (?, ?, ?)
2011-05-06 23:58:51,622 ERROR [http-8080-5] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFONE.SYS_C004301) violated
{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22467].
  {panel}

When serving static content or other non changing content the headers are Cache-Control and Expires Headers are set

e.g.
{quote}
HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified.
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1.
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate.
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT.
X-Confluence-Request-Time: 1305003489597.
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK.
Last-Modified: Tue, 10 May 2011 02:32:37 GMT.
ETag: "1304994757000".
Date: Tue, 10 May 2011 04:58:09 GMT.
{quote}

This disables caching in any intervening cache.

We are setting up Apache as a reverse caching proxy but because of those headers it doesn't cache.
fields.summary: static content, cache control and expires headers

fields.description: When updating the content permissions on a page with many descendants, Confluence will generate a large number of events that it will send to the other nodes in the cluster one at a time.  Confluence should batch these operations up so that the changes can be made in bulk on each node instead.
fields.summary: Content Permission changes are propagated between nodes one at a time, should be in bulk

fields.description: When Confluence is configured to serve content from a HTTPS URL, the iframe shown by the What's New dialog still uses HTTP, and will trigger warnings that some content on the page is insecure. Confluence should (wherever practical) match the HTTP/HTTPS protocol for all content it serves or hosts on the same page. In this case, it should use a HTTPS URL for the What's New dialog whenever the server is accessed via an HTTPS URL.
fields.summary: What's New content triggers insecure content warning with https

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22464].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 26, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
I’m excited to let you know that the [latest release of Crowd Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/crowd-3-3-release-notes-958762272.html] features the ability for you to delegate user admin management to space admins, with the ‘delegated group level admin’ feature.

For those of you who aren’t familiar with [Crowd Data Center|https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/enterprise/data-center], it offers one place to manage your users, groups and directories and easily integrate your identity infrastructure across all self-hosted Atlassian products 

I’m leaving this suggestion open, as I appreciate that this only provides a solution to those of you who currently have, or are considering investing in Crowd. However, to set expectations, this isn’t something we’re currently planning on working on within Confluence Server.

Best
Jenny | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server

{panel}

There are several operations that are unnecessarily complicated in the Confluence user management UI because the user management operates across all the directories.

Confluence should provide method of administering users, groups and memberships on a single directory. This would permit, for example:

* adding a user to a directory when a user with the same username already exists in a different directory
* management of shadowed users, those where a user with the same username exists in a different directory
* remove membership on one directory but not on another.

This is how the Crowd UI works actually. It provides an amalgamated view from a particular application, but management is done on a per-directory level. This makes user administration much more logical in complicated situations.

*Development notes*

To implement this, you can use the DirectoryService which is provided by Crowd and used by Crowd internally. There shouldn't be a need to implement a new API, rather "just" the addition of a dozen or so screens.
fields.summary: Provide per-directory user management screens

fields.description:
A customer with a large number of users in LDAP in 3.4.x or below would need to set up 3.5+ without migrating the atlassian-user.xml file (as automatic migration for large LDAP instances is not supported), so that no LDAP directory is set up in 3.5+. This involves adding the LDAP directory again manually, but all group memberships between LDAP users and local groups or LDAP groups and local users are lost. Confluence doesn't currently support an easy migration of this configuration.

A manual migration process needs to be put in place that allows such users to migrate their memberships.

h3. Solution

Follow the "Resolution" steps in the [LDAP synchronisation process takes too long if number of users or groups is large|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/LDAP+synchronisation+process+takes+too+long+if+number+of+users+or+groups+is+large] KB article.
fields.summary: Support migration of pre-3.5 groups and memberships of external users to 3.5+ "Internal with LDAP authentication" directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22442].
  {panel}

The Gallery macro should have the ability to not only sort but also filter the files it will display.

You can already select images to include (or exclude), but that only takes a comma-separated list of exactly specified filenames, and the point of a gallery macro is to easily display a bunch of images without writing their full name. (Maybe the name is unknown, e.g. when creating templates).

E.g. let's say I want to display a gallery with all files beginning with "idea*" (e.g. idea1.png, idea2.png, etc) at the top of my page, while at the same time have a gallery at the bottom with files named "result*.png". Note that I might also have other files that I do not want to display, e.g. "balance.png, zero-selection.png and results-details.jpg".

It would also be very useful if it was possible to filter by comment (as well as filename - both at the same time), e.g. displaying all images with the word "good" or "NMR" in the comment.
fields.summary: Gallery macro: Allow (multiple) filtering of the files displayed

fields.description:
h5. Description

When using the Documentation theme, by default "[" will toggle the left-hand navigation bar. However, the Windows key between the Ctrl and Alt will toggle left-hand navigation bar also.

While this does not effect the functionality of Confluence, but it is actually quite annoying, as some users will use the Windows key to bring up the start menu, and at the same time, toggle the navigation bar.

This happen in:

- Firefox
- Internet Explorer
- Chrome

\\
h5. Steps To Reproduce

# Set the theme to Documentation theme, either globally or space.
# Visit any page and press the Windows key in between Ctrl and Alt.
# Watch the magic happen.

\\
h5. Workaround
Changing the assigned shortcut key resolves this issue. To do so, modify the below property in C:\confluence\data\bundled-plugins\confluence-keyboard-shortcuts-3.5.5.jar\atlassian-plugin.xml
{code}
<description key="admin.keyboard.shortcut.toggle.navigation.panel.desc">Toggle Navigation Panel</description>
        <shortcut>[</shortcut>
{code}
Replace [ with * (or whatever your desired shortcut key is).

Save the modified jar file and re-package C:Program Files\Atlassian\confluence-3.5.5-std\confluence\WEB-INF\atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip with the modified confluence-keyboard-shortcuts-3.5.5.jar.

It is important to re-package modifications in to atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip, as any discrepancies between installed jar files and this file would be overwritten with content of this zip file.
fields.summary: Windows key toggle left-hand navigation bar in Documentation theme.

fields.description:
There is a lot of contention in the Bandana table that can cause deadlocks, which can lead to Confluence running out of database connections and falling over with messages like:

{noformat}2011-05-04 05:17:50,594 ERROR [TP-Processor1545] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Cannot get a connection, pool error Timeout waiting for idle object{noformat}

Things to do:

* Modify the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns adding not null constraints
* Add a unique constraint to the Bandana table on the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns
* Modify the HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao.saveOrUpdate method so that if an insert fails with a violation of the constraint, it tries an update
* Remove the synchronizing lock from the HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao.saveOrUpdate method.
fields.summary: Bandana table has high contention

fields.description:

{noformat}

The work around is to update the database and enable the directory.

Otherwise, make sure that the hibernate repository is included prior to the upgrade.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22423].
  {panel}

In our instance of Confluence we have many different spaces that are really geared towards several different types of users.  When I search for something I really only want to search certain spaces.  I get a lot of results from spaces that I know don't contain the desired information.  It would be nice if I could exclude these spaces from my searches by default.  If for any reason I ever want to search them, I would need to take an extra step.

To clarify, our wiki is used by developers, project managers and clients.  Some of the spaces are geared towards clients which I rarely need to search.  However the same terms appear in the client spaces and the internal spaces, so I get a lot of 'noise' from the client spaces when I run a search.  There are rare times when I need to use those spaces, so it's not as simple as removing my permission to see those spaces.

I'm envisioning something similar to google's search.  When I search for 'java' on google, it knows that I mean the programming language instead of coffee or a place in Indonesia.  This feature doesn't have to be intelligent enough to configure it's self based on my usage.  Even it if is a special page that I configure to only search spaces A, B and C.

Confluence it a great product, but imo the search functionality is a weak point.
fields.summary: Allow a Search operation to be limited to particular spaces based on user

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# [Integrate with Crowd with SSO|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+Crowd+or+JIRA+for+User+Management]
# Go to Confluence Admin, it does not prompt to enter password (websudo)
# Go to Security Configuration. Note that it will look something like this: [^security_configuration.png]
{quote}
CAPTCHA on login      Enable
This option cannot be enabled. See [this issue|CONF-20958] for details.
Secure administrator sessions      Enable
This option cannot be enabled. See [this issue|CONF-20958] for details.
{quote}
# Edit it, it can't be enabled: [^edit_security_configuration.png]

h5. Finding
This used to work fine in Confluence 3.4.x

h5. Possible cause
It seems that Confluence takes Crowd authenticator as custom authenticator? [CONF-20958]

h5. Workaround
Add the following flag as described [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties]:
{noformat}
-Dpassword.confirmation.disabled=false
{noformat}
fields.summary: websudo does not work with Confluence when it's integrated with Crowd SSO

fields.description:
Raising this issue on behalf of [CSP-60942|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-60942]:

The following
{code}
#macro( recursePages $page )
	#applyDecorator("decoratorbug-decorator")
		#decoratorParam("text" $page.title)
		
		#foreach( $subPage in $page.sortedChildren )
			#recursePages( $subPage )
		#end
		
		## uncomment this to make it work again
		##decoratorParam("text" $page.title)
	#end
#end
{code}
fails to render properly.
The inner calls of #applyDecorator clear the parameter values of the outer calls.

The code comments in /confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/setup/velocity/ApplyDecoratorDirective.java hint towards this, too:
{code}
/**
 * Each directive instance appears to be bound to a template file (.vmd). Therefore, we need to
 * ensure that we reset the params for each time the inline directive is applied. If not, we will
 * see parameters being shared between requests.
 */
 getParams().clear();
{code}

However, this is unexpected behavior and in general calls to #decoratorParam should have an effect regardless of their occurence relative to recursive calls to #applyDecorator.

[^decoratorbug.zip]
{quote}
The following plugin demonstrates the bug.
Just go to admin/username->DecoratorBug and see it yourself.
{quote}

[^screenshot-1.jpg]
{quote}
Notice how there are two occurences of $\{text}. These are the outer decorator applications whose parameters are wiped out by the nested decorator applications.
{quote}
fields.summary: #applyDecorator calls inside a recursive velocity macro lose their parameter values

fields.description:
The dashboard can be extremely slow to render if nested groups are enabled with an LDAP repository. It needs to be improved so that it works almost as quickly as when nested groups are not used.

This issue only affects Confluence 3.5 - 3.5.4. It is resolved in Confluence 3.5.5

h2. Patch

For Confluence 3.5 - 3.5.4, customers can apply the following patch. Attached is [^CONF-22414-patch-3.zip], a patch for improving caching for all permission checks involving nested groups. This patch supersedes any previous patch for the same issue.

h3. Contents
The patch contains 26 files in 6 directories as follows:
 * confluence/WEB-INF/classes
   ** embeddedCrowdContext.xml
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/core
     *** ConfluenceActionSupport.properties
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/search/lucene/filter
     *** 4x HibernateSpacePermissionsFilterDao classes
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/space/persistence/dao/hibernate
     *** HibernateSpacesQueryBuilder.class
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/user
     *** DefaultUserAccessor.class
     *** UserAccessor.class
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/user/crowd
     *** 3x CachedCrowdGroupDao classes
     *** CachedCrowdInternalMembershipDao.class
     *** 2x CachedCrowdMembershipCacheKey classes
     *** CachedCrowdMembershipDao.class
     *** 3x CachedCrowdUserDao classes
     *** 2x DefaultGroupMembershipCache classes
     *** DefaultMembershipCache.class
     *** GroupMembershipCache.class
     *** MembershipCache.class
     *** 2x NameUtils classes

h3. Installation
To install the patch:
# Stop Confluence
# Extract the zip to your {{<confluence install dir>}}. If prompted, overwrite existing files. If you have any existing patch for any of these classes, this will overwrite them.
# Start Confluence

fields.description:
When Confluence is using MS SQL, there is a database property called 'Database Connection Transaction Isolation'.

This information is very useful if printed in the log file, because Confluence cannot function properly if we are not using {{Read Committed with Row Versioning}} isolation level.

At the moment this info is only visible^ in Confluence Admin > System Information, under *Database Connection Transaction Isolation*.

It looks like this in the log file right now:
{noformat}
--------------------------
Database Information
--------------------------
Database Dialect: net.sf.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerDialect
Database Driver Name: net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver
Database Driver Version: 1.2
Database Name: Microsoft SQL Server
Database  Version: 09.00.3054
Database Latency:0
--------------------------
System Information
--------------------------
{noformat}

^Generally the admin won't be able to access the GUI because Confluence can't start.

See also https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/STP-57
fields.summary: 'Database Connection Transaction Isolation' is not printed in the atlassian-confluence.log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22412].
  {panel}

We hit this when we upgraded from Confluence 3.4 to Confluence 3.5.2. We were using the swisscom nested group adapter successfully before and had set the filter (atlassian-user.xml) to groups with name "PREFIX_OF_WIKI_GROUPS*" and search started from AD root (nested groups can be in many places). Now when we upgraded to Crowd and removed the old nested group library (swisscom), nested groups no longer worked.

After fighting the issue for a while we finally figured that nested group search is also affected with the filter (unlike in swisscom).

We would like to have only groups starting with PREFIX_OF_WIKI_GROUPS groups listed in group search but we would like the nested search to retrieve nested groups without restrictions. In effect this would give all PREFIX_OF_WIKI_GROUPS* groups' members (even from nested group named NOTAWIKIGROUP) and list only groups starting with PREFIX_OF_WIKI_GROUPS in group browser.

In short. I'm looking for a configuration option for embedded Crowd: "Apply group filter when searching nested groups" it seems to be on now and I would like to set it off.

We have now 3000+ unwanted groups listed in Confluence after the upgrade.
fields.summary: Allow configuration for whether to use group filter when retrieving nested groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22393].
  {panel}

We are using Delegated LDAP Authentication in 3.5. In Confluence prior to version 3.5, the administrator could assign LDAP users to Confluence groups and then allow them to log in.

In version 3.5 and higher:
# LDAP users must login first (so that a Confluence user is created)
# Be auto assigned to the confluence-users group
# Then contact the administrator
# Then the Administrator updates the user / group details
# Then the admin contacts the user to let them know that they now have access to the additional space / group.

This process is too slow and cumbersome.

The Administrator should be able to view all users in the LDAP directory, create them as Confluence users and fully set up their access rights / groups.
fields.summary: Confluence Administrator should be able to create new Confluence users from LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22392].
  {panel}

We use LDAP for all of our user authentication (Delegated LDAP Authentication).

When using the {{\[~username\]}} notation in 3.5 and higher, the user name and details are only correctly displayed if the username is a registered user in Confluence. Confluence does not automatically search for the user in LDAP as it did in previous versions.

This is a problem for us as many pages refer to people who have never logged into Confluence and are only defined in LDAP (we have < 100 Confluence users and over 250,000 users in LDAP).

The macro behind {{\[~username\]}} should check against all of the user directories when attempting to resolve the username.
fields.summary: support [~username] notation in LDAP only users

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22388].
  {panel}

It is possible to see which user exists on Confluence or not from within "Forgot Password" link.

This is bad for security reasons.

If you enter a non-existant username, it currently warns "No user with that username exists". 

Instead, the feature should give same message, regardless of whether the username given actually exists or not, such as "Please check the email address you signed up with".

We appreciate your consideration.

Regards,
JP Support

This is a weird bug, when you have a page called "test-one" for instance and you create a link ([test-one]) for this page in another page, the link gets like this: "[test-one|test-one]". Somehow Confluence seems to add a alias to the link automatically.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page called _Test_
# Create another page called _test-one_
# In the _Test_ page create a link like the following for the _test-one_ page: [test-one]
# Save the page. The link will work fine.
# Edit the page, go to the Wiki Markup tab and observe the link became: "[test-one|test-one]"
||

This only happens to links with the "-" in the page title.
fields.summary: Problem Creating Link to a Page when the Page Title contains "-"

fields.description:
CONF-3589 required existing mail servers to be modified on upgrade. Some instances are not upgrading correctly, meaning notifications cannot be sent and the Share Page button will not work. The logs will show
{code}
SEVERE: Internal server error
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.jmx.JmxSMTPMailServer
{code}

Administration emails (the Test Mail server email, forgotten password emails) will not be affected.

h4. Cause

One or more upgrade tasks were not run, and *your data could be corrupted*. To fix this, you need to restore your confluence data directory and database to how they were before the upgrade, fix the root cause of the upgrade failure, and retry the upgrade. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/k0QC. If this happened on a site restore from XML backup, correct the root cause of the upgrade failure (which may be inside the XML backup), and restore from the corrected file. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/4lEC. Look at your atlassian-confluence.log file in your confluence data directory for details of the upgrade failure.

h4. Workaround

If you cannot for any reason restore from backup, and need to patch your existing server, you can fix this particular error with the following steps:
# Record your existing mail server configuration
# Delete the mail server via the UI
# Add a new mail server via the UI with exactly the same configuration

After you've done this, the Share Page button should work.
fields.summary: Notifications fail because Mail Server does not upgrade properly

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce the problem:
# Create a test page
# Attach any excel document 
# Add the Excel macro (to include a excel sheet) in a page
# Edit the Excel sheet by clicking at 'Edit Document' button (to open the Excel sheet)
# Add a auto-filter in Excel and use the filter
# Save the latest changes made
# Refresh the test page where it has the Excel macro
# The display does not change according to the last saved filter in Excel
|

In the latest Confluence 3.5.x however, clicking on the Save button after adding the auto-filter will prompt you to save into another new copy. For the previous version of Confluence, this scenario doesn't happen. 

Also, for the previous version of Confluence, after saving the Excel file again after adding the filter and clicking again on the 'Edit Document' button, will open the Excel file as the last saved filter in Excel. This means that the last saved filter in Excel is working but the display of Excel with viewfile does not respect filter that was last saved after editing.
fields.summary: Display Excel with viewfile does not respect filter that was last saved after editing

fields.description:
The upgrade log gave a warning like below, and it appears that Confluence was going to skip the duplicate and proceed with the upgrade. 

But the upgrade failed because of duplicate membership anyway:
{code}
2011-04-13 14:48:38,854 WARN [main] [confluence.user.migration.AtlassianUserDataMigrator] processRowInternal Duplicate entries found for user name 'nbhawnani', which probably means there were two user names which only differed by case. The first entry found was used, so this user's password and details may not be correct.
:
:
2011-04-13 14:48:41,416 ERROR [main] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions ORA-00001: unique constraint (CFLUENCE.CWD_UNIQUE_MEMBERSHIP) violated

2011-04-13 14:48:41,417 ERROR [main] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
2011-04-13 14:48:41,678 ERROR [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener] contextInitialized Upgrade failed, application will not start: java.lang.RuntimeException: net.sf.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not insert: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembership#23332935
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: net.sf.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not insert: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembership#23332935
at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:109)
at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.impl.DefaultUpgradeManager.upgrade(DefaultUpgradeManager.java:139)
at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener.contextInitialized(UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener.java:28)
at org.mortbay.jetty.handler.ContextHandler.startContext(ContextHandler.java:548)
:
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: net.sf.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not insert: com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembership#23332935
at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.SessionClearingRowCallbackHandler.flushAndClear(SessionClearingRowCallbackHandler.java:54)
at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.SessionClearingRowCallbackHandler.processRow(SessionClearingRowCallbackHandler.java:41)
at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate$RowCallbackHandlerResultSetExtractor.extractData(JdbcTemplate.java:1248)
at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate$1QueryStatementCallback.doInStatement(JdbcTemplate.java:395)
at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate.execute(JdbcTemplate.java:343)
at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate.query(JdbcTemplate.java:405)
at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate.query(JdbcTemplate.java:409)
at com.atlassian.confluence.user.migration.AtlassianUserDataMigrator.migrateGroupMemberships(AtlassianUserDataMigrator.java:176)
at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.AtlassianUserToEmbeddedCrowdDataUpgradeTask.doUpgrade(AtlassianUserToEmbeddedCrowdDataUpgradeTask.java:74)
:
:
{code}

Either make the warning into an error or make Confluence proceed as planned like what the warning said - ignore the duplicate and make the upgrade successful.

h5. Work around
Execute this query:
{code}
select name, count(name) from users group by name having count(name) > 1;
{code}

You can identify which one to delete from their last login date:
{code}
select u.name, u.id, p.date_val as lastLogin from users u
join OS_PROPERTYENTRY p on u.id = p.entity_ID
where entity_key='confluence.user.last.login.date' AND u.name='yourDuplicateUserName'
order by date_val desc;
{code}

Then delete them:
{code}
delete from local_members where userid = xxx;
delete from users where id = xxx;
{code}
